conclusion: Understand the setup: The light source is placed at the focal point F of the paraboloid. Light rays are reflected and enter the hemispherical lens perpendicular to the vertical diameter MN.
Identify critical angles: The refractive index n = 4/3.
Determine the critical angle for total internal reflection using sin C = 1/n. Calculate sin C = 3/4, so C = arcsin(3/4).
Apply Snell's Law at the intersection point P where light enters the lens: n sin C = sin α. Solve for α with α = arcsin(3/4) = 48.59°.
Relate arc length to geometry: The angle ∠MNC = 48.59°.
The length l of the transparent arc is given by l = R · ∠MNC.
Calculate the arc length using the angle in radians: ∠MNC = 48.59° × π/180.
The formula for the arc length is l = R · (48.59 × π/180).
Final answer: The length of the transparent part of all the light entering perpendicular to MN on the lens spherical surface is 4/5 R.
